00020 
00021 std::string * make_absolute(const char * relpath)
00022 {
00023         char cwd[PATHLEN_MAX];
00024         size_t cwdlen;
00025         int trslash;
00026         std::string *abspath = new string(relpath);
00027         
00028         if(abspath->at(0) == '/')
00029                 return abspath;
00030         
00031         if (!getcwd(cwd, PATHLEN_MAX)) {
00032                 perror("Unable to get current working directory");
00033                 delete abspath;
00034                 
00035                 return NULL;
00036         }
00037         cwdlen = strlen(cwd);
00038         ABORT((!cwdlen),"Zero-sized length of CWD!");
00039         
00040         trslash = (cwd[cwdlen-1] =='/') ? 1 : 0;
00041         /*append the cwd to the relative path*/
00042         abspath->insert(0, cwd, cwdlen);
00043         if(!trslash)
00044                 abspath->insert(cwdlen,"/");
00045         /* must have a trailing slash */
00046         if(abspath->at(abspath->length()-1) != '/')
00047                 abspath->push_back('/');
00048         
00049         DBG_PRINT("absolute branch path: %s\n", abspath->c_str());
00050         
00051         return abspath;
00052 }
00053 
00054 std::string * resolve_path(HybfsData *hybfs_core, const char *path, int *brid)
00055 {
00056         std::string *abspath;
00057 
00058         /* TODO 
00059          * of course, the path should be found, but in our case, we start with
00060          * only one mounted directory
00061          */
00062         *brid = 0;
00063         abspath = new string(hybfs_core->get_branch_path(*brid));
00064         if(abspath == NULL)
00065                 return NULL;
00066         
00067         abspath->append(path);
00068 
00069         return abspath;
00070 }
00071 
00072 void break_tag(std::string *tag_value, std::string *tag, std::string *value)
00073 {
00074         size_t fpos = tag_value->find(":");
00075         
00076         if(fpos != string::npos) {
00077                 tag->assign(tag_value->substr(0, fpos));
00078                 value->assign(tag_value->substr(fpos+1, tag_value->length() - 1));
00079         }
00080         else
00081                 tag->assign(*tag_value);
00082 }
